name: Open Make Software
tag_list: devops-suite, openmake-mojo, openmake-meister, openmake-deploy, openmake-cloudbuilder, remote-agents-microsoft-visual-studio-tfs, teambuild, ibm-clearcase, buildforge, ca-harvestca-scm, mks-integrity, accurev, subversion, teamforge, cvs, serena-pvcs, sere
overview:
OpenMake Software automates build and deploy operations of software development.

OpenMake® Software, the DevOps Authority, delivers a dynamic solution for streamlining, accelerating, and standardizing build to deploy activities that can flex to meet your ever increasing operational demands. Our solutions automate tasks by eliminating script driven processes and static configurations while supporting continuous build and deploy. We enable you to manage incremental releases, leverage the cloud, increase productivity, eliminate bottlenecks, and provide management with actionable traceability reports. Over 400 companies worldwide use our solutions to dynamically align the development to release process from source to production. 

OpenMake Software has been the authority on the build, test and release process since 1995, providing Global 2000 companies with solid solutions for managing the development operations challenge.  Our experience has taught us that streamlining the build, test and deploy process cannot be done by cobbling together static scripts around a process engine.  Instead, we offer a dynamic DevOps framework that reduces cost through re-use, minimizes errors by achieving repeatability and openly communicates process through a shared community developed Knowledge Base.   OpenMake Software products are designed based on customer input; therefore developer productivity and the elimination of manual errors has been a primary focus. Over 100,000 users at 400 companies worldwide use OpenMake Software products to manage their software build and deploy process across the enterprise from development to production. OpenMake Software also provides expert consulting to assist customers in implementing SCM, build, test and deploy processes. OpenMake Software has been privately held and self-funded since 1995.
